answerText: DNA Ligase[10] In mammals, DNA Ligase I is necessary for combining these short fragments of DNA. They're necessary because DNA polymerase can only add to the 3 prime end of an existing nucleotide chain.
heading: ACF Winter |2009 | Carnegie Mellon University and University of Central Florida | 6 | Science | Biology | College
subject: Science
question: Question: Identify the following involved in DNA replication, FTPE:   [10] This enzyme is necessary for creating the final phosphodiester bond needed to link two strands of DNA to each other.
